original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammānuloma (1), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma anuloma tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The Triad-duka Paṭṭhāna Discourse

original: 4.5. Kusalattika, Mahantaradukaupādānagocchaka🔽4.5.1. Kusalattika, Sārammaṇaduka
analyzed: kusalattika mahantaraduka aupādānagocchaka  kusala ttika sa ārammaṇa duka
translated: … the wholesome triad, the great triad, the origin triad🔽… the wholesome triad, the object triad

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The Condition Category

original: Kusalaṁ sārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kusalo sārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Akusalaṁ sārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo sārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: kusalam sa ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  akusalam sa ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a wholesome object as condition, a wholesome object arises, a condition being by way of root condition.🔽With an unwholesome object as condition, an unwholesome object arises, a condition being by way of root condition.

original: Abyākataṁ sārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato sārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: abyākatam sa ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an indeterminate object as condition, an indeterminate object arises, a condition being by way of root condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi pe vipāke ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With root cause, there are three. With object, there are three. … With result, there is one. … With an unobscured object, there are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vārampi pe sampayutta vārampi paṭicca vāra sadisa
translated: (The section on the conascence condition … and so on is similar to the section on the dependent origination condition.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa
translated: Root-cause and object

original: Kusalo sārammaṇo dhammo kusalassa sārammaṇassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: kusalaḥ sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa sa ārammaṇassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A wholesome object is a condition, being a root condition, for a wholesome object.

original: Akusalo sārammaṇo dhammo akusalassa sārammaṇassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: akusalaḥ sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ akusalassa sa ārammaṇassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An unwholesome consciousness element is related to an unwholesome consciousness element as a condition being a decisive support condition.

original: Abyākato sārammaṇo dhammo abyākatassa sārammaṇassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: abyākataḥ sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa sa ārammaṇassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An indeterminate consciousness element is related to an indeterminate consciousness element as a condition being a decisive support condition.

original: Kusalo sārammaṇo dhammo kusalassa sārammaṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā satta, anantare satta …pe… sahajāte aññamaññe🔽nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye nava, āsevane tīṇi, kamme pañca, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre …pe…
analyzed: kusalaḥ sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa sa ārammaṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta  hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā satta anantare satta pe sahajāte aññamaññe  nissaye tīṇi upanissaye nava āsevane tīṇi kamme pañca vipāke eka āhāre pe
translated: A wholesome consciousness element is related to a wholesome consciousness element as a condition being a decisive support condition.

original: sampayutte tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: sampayutte tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: In the case of the root cause, there are three; in the case of the object, there are nine; in the case of the predominance, there are seven; in the case of the proximity, there are seven; in the case of the contiguity, there are seven; in the case of the condition being present, there are seven; in the case of the arising together, there are seven; in the case of the falling away, there are seven; in the case of the support, there are seven; in the case of the dissociation, there are seven; in the case of the presence, there are seven; in the case of the nondisappearance, there are seven; in the case of the nutriment, there are five; in the case of the faculty, there are five; in the case of the path, there are five; in the case of the association, there are three; in the case of the dissociation, there are three; in the case of the presence, there are three; in the case of the nondisappearance, there are three.

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)🔽Hetusahajātādi🔽Abyākataṁ anārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato anārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam  hetu sahajāta ādi  abyākatam anārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ anārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: (The section on the root cause should be expanded in detail as in the case of the wholesome triad.)🔽Root cause, arising together, etc.

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyāḥ ekam pe avigate eka
translated: A root cause condition is a condition being a root cause condition. A root cause condition is a condition being an object condition. A root cause condition is a condition being an object condition and a decisive support condition. A root cause condition is a condition being an object condition, a decisive support condition, and a proximity condition. A root cause condition is a condition being an object condition, a decisive support condition, a proximity condition, and a contiguity condition. A root cause condition is a condition being an object condition, a decisive support condition, a proximity condition, a contiguity condition, and a condition being present condition. A root cause condition is a condition being an object condition, a decisive support condition, a proximity condition, a contiguity condition, a condition being present condition, and an arising together condition. A root cause condition is a condition being an object condition, a decisive support condition, a proximity condition, a contiguity condition, a condition

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ …pe… novigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyāḥ ekam pe na u vigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: With no cause as condition … With no outcome … (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vārampi pe sampayutta vārampi paṭicca vāra sadisa
translated: (The section on origination should be elaborated in detail here as in the Dependent Origination.)

original: Abyākato anārammaṇo dhammo abyākatassa anārammaṇassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: abyākataḥ anārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa anārammaṇassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena
translated: An unwholesome citta element is a condition, as co-nascence condition, …

original: paccayo … aññamaññapaccayena paccayo … nissayapaccayena paccayo … āhārapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ āhāra paccayena
translated: as mutuality condition, … as support condition, … as nutriment condition, …

original: paccayo … indriyapaccayena paccayo … atthipaccayena paccayo … avigatapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: paccayaḥ indriya paccayena paccayaḥ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ avigata paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: as faculty condition, … as presence condition, … as non-disappearance condition,

original: (sabbattha ekaṁ. Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: sabbattha eka saṅkhitta
translated: (everywhere one.) (Abbreviated.)

original: 4.5.2. Kusalattika, Cittaduka
analyzed: kusalattika
translated: … the wholesome triad, the mind-set of two

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The four condition tetrads

original: Kusalo citto dhammo kusalassa cittassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: kusalaḥ cittaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa cittassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A wholesome mind-element is a condition, as object condition, for a wholesome mind-element. (Abbreviated.)

original: Ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā satta, anantare satta …pe… upanissaye nava, āsevane tīṇi, natthiyā satta, vigate satta. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā satta anantare satta pe upanissaye nava āsevane tīṇi natthiyā satta vigate satta saṅkhitta
translated: In the object nine, in the dominant seven, in the antecedent seven, … in the support nine, in the kamma three, in the absence seven, in the disappearance seven. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: With no cause nine, with no object nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)🔽Kusalaṁ nocittaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kusalo nocitto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam  kusalam no cittam dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ no cittaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: (As in the case of the Triad of the Wholesome, the question section is to be elaborated in detail.)

With a wholesome consciousness as condition there arise a wholesome consciousness element and a wholesome mental factor. With a wholesome consciousness as condition there arises a wholesome mentality-materiality. With a wholesome consciousness as condition there arise a wholesome consciousness element and a wholesome mentality-materiality. With a wholesome consciousness as condition there arises a wholesome mentality-materiality and a wholesome mental factor. With a wholesome consciousness as condition there arise a wholesome consciousness element, a wholesome mentality-materiality, and a wholesome mental factor.

original: Kusalaṁ nocittañca abyākataṁ nocittañca dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato nocitto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: kusalam no cittam ca abyākatam no cittañca dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ no cittaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā

With an unwholesome consciousness as condition there arise an unwholesome consciousness element and an unwholesome mental factor. With an unwholesome consciousness as condition there arises an unwholesome mentality-materiality. With an unwholesome consciousness as condition there arise an unwholesome consciousness element and an unwholesome mentality-materiality. With an unwholesome consciousness as condition there arises an unwholesome mentality-materiality and an unwholesome mental factor. With an unwholesome consciousness as condition there arise an unwholesome consciousness element, an unwholesome mentality-materiality, and an unwholesome mental factor.

original: Akusalaṁ nocittañca abyākataṁ nocittañca dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato nocitto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: akusalam no cittam ca abyākatam no cittañca dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ no cittaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a neutral consciousness as condition there arises a neutral consciousness element. With a neutral consciousness as condition there arises a neutral mental factor. With a neutral consciousness as condition there arise a neutral consciousness element and a neutral mental factor. With a neutral consciousness as condition there arises a neutral mentality-materiality. With a neutral consciousness as condition there arise a neutral consciousness element and a neutral mentality-materiality. With a neutral consciousness as condition there arises a neutral mentality-materiality and a neutral mental factor. With a neutral consciousness as condition there arise a neutral consciousness element, a neutral mentality-materiality, and a neutral mental factor.

analyzed: kusalam no cittam dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ no cittaḥ dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā 🔽hetuyā nava ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā nava pe vipāke ekam pe avigate nava

With a wholesome consciousness as condition there arises a wholesome mentality-materiality. With a wholesome consciousness as condition there arises a wholesome consciousness element and a wholesome mentality-materiality. original: Kusalo nocitto dhammo kusalassa nocittassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: kusalaḥ no cittaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa no cittassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A profitable thought is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a non-causally generated profitable thought. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā satta, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā dasa …pe… avigate terasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā satta ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā dasa pe avigate terasa
translated: As root-cause seven, as object nine, as predominance ten, … as non-hindrance thirteen. (Abbreviated.)

original: 4.5.3. Kusalattika, Cetasikaduka
analyzed: kusalattika
translated: … profitable triad, mental-data dyad

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: Condition-Tern

original: Kusalaṁ cetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kusalo cetasiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Akusalaṁ cetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo cetasiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: kusalam cetasikam dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ cetasikaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  akusalam cetasikam dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ cetasikaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With profitable root-cause as condition, a profitable mental data arise.🔽With unprofitable root-cause as condition, an unprofitable mental data arise.

original: Abyākataṁ cetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato cetasiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: abyākatam cetasikam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ cetasikaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With indeterminate root-cause as condition, an indeterminate mental data arise. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi pe vipāke ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: As root-cause three, as object three, … as kamma-result one, … as non-hindrance three. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vārampi pe sampayutta vārampi paṭicca vāra sadisa
translated: (The section on the conascent, etc., is to be elaborated in the same way as the section on condition.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa
translated: Root-cause and object

original: Kusalo cetasiko dhammo kusalassa cetasikassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: kusalaḥ cetasikaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa cetasikassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A profitable mind-consciousness element is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a profitable mind-consciousness element.

original: Akusalo cetasiko dhammo akusalassa cetasikassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: akusalaḥ cetasikaḥ dhammaḥ akusalassa cetasikassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An unprofitable mind-consciousness element is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an unprofitable mind-consciousness element.

original: Abyākato cetasiko dhammo abyākatassa cetasikassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: abyākataḥ cetasikaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa cetasikassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An indeterminate mind-consciousness element is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an indeterminate mind-consciousness element.

original: Kusalo cetasiko dhammo kusalassa cetasikassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Akusalo cetasiko dhammo akusalassa cetasikassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: kusalaḥ cetasikaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa cetasikassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  akusalaḥ cetasikaḥ dhammaḥ akusalassa cetasikassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A profitable mind-consciousness element is a condition, as object condition, for a profitable mind-consciousness element … for three …🔽An unprofitable mind-consciousness element is a condition, as object condition, for an unprofitable mind-consciousness element … for three …

original: Abyākato cetasiko dhammo abyākatassa cetasikassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: abyākataḥ cetasikaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa cetasikassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: An indeterminate mind-consciousness element is a condition, as object condition, for an indeterminate mind-consciousness element … for three … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā satta, anantare satta …pe… sahajāte aññamaññe
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā satta anantare satta pe sahajāte aññamaññe
translated: As to root-cause, there are three; as to object, there are nine; as to predominance, there are seven; as to proximity, there are seven … as to contiguity, there are seven … as to presence, there are seven … as to absence, there are seven … as to disappearance, there are seven … as to non-disappearance, there are seven … as to arising, there are seven … as to presence and absence, there are seven … as to disappearance and non-disappearance, there are seven …

original: nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye nava, āsevane tīṇi, kamme pañca, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre …pe…
analyzed: nissaye tīṇi upanissaye nava āsevane tīṇi kamme pañca vipāke eka āhāre pe
translated: As to support, there are three; as to decisive support, there are nine; as to kamma, there are five; as to kamma-result, there is one; as to nutriment, there are five; as to faculty, there are five; as to jhāna, there are five; as to path, there are five; as to association, there are five; as to dissociation, there are five; as to presence, there are five; as to absence, there are five; as to disappearance, there are five; as to non-disappearance, there are five; as to arising, there are five; as to presence and absence, there are five; as to disappearance and non-disappearance, there are five; as to cessation, there are five; as to non-cessation, there are five; as to fading away, there are five; as to non-fading away, there are five; as to development, there are five; as to non-development, there are five; as to object, there are five; as to non-object, there are five; as to non-disappearance and non-development, there are five

original: sampayutte tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: sampayutte tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: with factors that are related … with those that are not in opposition … (abridged as in the section on wholesome consciousness) …

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)🔽Kusalaṁ acetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato acetasiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam  kusalam acetasikam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: (The section on the questions is to be expanded as in the case of the triad of wholesome consciousness.)🔽A resultant, mind-without-threshold consciousness arises in dependence on a wholesome, mind-without-threshold consciousness, with which it is causally connected.

original: Akusalaṁ acetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato acetasiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: akusalam acetasikam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ acetasikaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A resultant, mind-without-threshold consciousness arises in dependence on an unwholesome, mind-without-threshold consciousness, with which it is causally connected.

original: Abyākataṁ acetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato acetasiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Kusalaṁ acetasikañca abyākataṁ acetasikañca dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato acetasiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: abyākatam acetasikam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ acetasikaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  kusalam acetasikam ca abyākatam acetasikañca dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A resultant, mind-without-threshold consciousness arises in dependence on an indeterminate, mind-without-threshold consciousness, with which it is causally connected.🔽A resultant, mind-without-threshold consciousness arises in dependence on a wholesome, mind-without-threshold consciousness and an indeterminate, mind-without-threshold consciousness, with which it is causally connected.

original: Akusalaṁ acetasikañca abyākataṁ acetasikañca dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato acetasiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: akusalam acetasikam ca abyākatam acetasikañca dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A resultant, mind-without-threshold consciousness arises in dependence on an unwholesome, mind-without-threshold consciousness and an indeterminate, mind-without-threshold consciousness, with which it is causally connected. (abridged)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca.🔽Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe pañca, novigate pañca.
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe ekam pe avigate pañca 🔽na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe pañca no vigate pañca
translated: In the case of cause, there are five; in the case of object, there is one; … In the case of non-opposition, there are five.🔽In the case of non-cause, there is one; in the case of non-object, there are five; in the case of non-nongrasping, there are five.

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… pañhāvārampi evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe pañhā vāram pi evam
translated: … The wholesome triad, the wholesome dyads connected with mind, and so on

original: 4.5.4. Kusalattika, Cittasampayuttadukādi
translated: A wholesome consciousness that is connected with mind is a condition, as a condition that is a decisive support, for the wholesome thoughts that are connected with mind.🔽… A wholesome thought that is associated with mind is a condition, as a condition that is a decisive support, for the wholesome thoughts that are associated with mind.

original: Kusalaṁ cittasampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …pe… kusalaṁ cittasaṁsaṭṭhaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽…pe… kusalaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …pe… kusalaṁ cittasahabhuṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: kusalam citta sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca pe kusalam citta sasaṭṭham dhammam paṭicca  pe kusalam citta samuṭṭhānam dhammam paṭicca pe kusalam citta sahabhum dhamma
translated: … A wholesome thought that is a root of the wholesome is a condition, as a condition that is a decisive support, for the wholesome thoughts that are a root of the wholesome.🔽… A wholesome thought that is a great primary element is a condition, as a condition that is a decisive support, for the wholesome thoughts that are great primary elements.🔽… A wholesome thought that is a derivative of the great primaries is a condition, as a condition that is a decisive support, for the wholesome thoughts that are derivatives of the great primaries.🔽… A wholesome thought that is a derivative of the great primaries and is also a great primary element is a condition, as a condition that is a decisive support, for the wholesome thoughts that are derivatives of the great primaries and are also great primary elements.

original: paṭicca …pe… kusalaṁ cittānuparivattiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …pe… kusalaṁ cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānaṁ🔽dhammaṁ paṭicca …pe… kusalaṁ cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānasahabhuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …pe…
analyzed: paṭicca pe kusalam citta anuparivattim dhammam paṭicca pe kusalam citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna  dhammam paṭicca pe kusalam citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna sahabhum dhammam paṭicca pe
translated: … A wholesome thought that is a derivative of the great primaries and is also a great primary element is a condition, as a condition that is a decisive support, for the wholesome thoughts that are derivatives of the great primaries and are also great primary elements.🔽… A wholesome thought that is a derivative of the great primaries and is also a great primary element is a condition, as a condition that is a decisive support, for the wholesome thoughts that are derivatives of the great primaries and are also great primary elements.🔽… A wholesome thought that is a derivative of the great primaries and is also a great primary element is a condition, as a condition that is a decisive support, for the wholesome thoughts that are derivatives of the great primaries and are also great primary elements.

original: kusalaṁ cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānuparivattiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kusalo cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānuparivatti🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: kusalam citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna anuparivattim dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna anuparivatti  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: … A wholesome thought that is a derivative of the great primaries and is also a great primary element is a condition, as a condition that is a decisive support, for the wholesome thoughts that are derivatives of the great primaries and are also great primary elements.

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

translated: The fourfold condition for the unwholesome

translated: An unwholesome internal condition is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an unwholesome internal condition. (Abbreviated.)🔽As root-cause condition, one; as co-nascence condition, one; … as non-disappearance condition, one. (Abbreviated.)

translated: An unwholesome unclung-to element is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an unwholesome unclung-to element. … three.🔽An unwholesome unclung-to element is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an unwholesome unclung-to element. … three.

original: Akusalo anupādinno dhammo akusalassa anupādinnassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: akusalaḥ anupādinnaḥ dhammaḥ akusalassa anupādinnassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: An unwholesome, unproximate factor is a condition, as root cause condition, for an unwholesome, unproximate factor … three.

original: Abyākato anupādinno dhammo abyākatassa anupādinnassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Kusalo anupādinno dhammo kusalassa anupādinnassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: abyākataḥ anupādinnaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa anupādinnassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  kusalaḥ anupādinnaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa anupādinnassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: An indeterminate, unproximate factor is a condition, as root cause condition, for an indeterminate, unproximate factor.🔽A wholesome, unproximate factor is a condition, as object condition, for a wholesome, unproximate factor … three.

original: Akusalo anupādinno dhammo akusalassa anupādinnassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Abyākato anupādinno dhammo abyākatassa anupādinnassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: akusalaḥ anupādinnaḥ dhammaḥ akusalassa anupādinnassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  abyākataḥ anupādinnaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa anupādinnassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: An unwholesome, unproximate factor is a condition, as object condition, for an unwholesome, unproximate factor … three.

original: paccayo. Abyākato anupādinno dhammo kusalassa anupādinnassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ abyākataḥ anupādinnaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa anupādinnassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: An indeterminate, unproximate factor is a condition, as object condition, for an indeterminate, unproximate factor. An indeterminate, unproximate factor is a condition, as object condition, for a wholesome, unproximate factor.

original: paccayo. Abyākato anupādinno dhammo akusalassa anupādinnassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ abyākataḥ anupādinnaḥ dhammaḥ akusalassa anupādinnassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: Condition being a condition by way of object condition …

original: paccayo … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: paccayaḥ tīṇi saṅkhitta
translated: (The rest are condensed.)

original: Hetuyā satta, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā dasa, anantare cha …pe… sahajāte nava, aññamaññe
analyzed: hetuyā satta ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā dasa anantare cha pe sahajāte nava aññamaññe
translated: (Seven from the root, nine from object, ten from predominance, six from proximity … and so on … nine from conascence, three from mutuality,

original: tīṇi, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, purejāte pacchājāte āsevane tīṇi …pe… vippayutte🔽tīṇi …pe… avigate ekādasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: tīṇi nissaye nava upanissaye nava purejāte pacchājāte āsevane tīṇi pe vippayutte  tīṇi pe avigate ekādasa saṅkhitta
translated: nine from support, nine from nutriment, three from prenascence, three from postnascence, three from repetition, …🔽three from dissociation, …

original: Kusalattikamahantaradukaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.🔽4.5.8. Kusalattika, Upādānadukādi
analyzed: niṭṭhita
translated: eleven from absence of conflict. (The rest are condensed.)🔽The section on the root cause of the three wholesome is finished.🔽… The section on the root cause of the three unwholesome …

original: Akusalaṁ upādānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo upādāno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: akusalam upādānam dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ upādānaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: From an unwholesome, clinging condition …🔽(The rest are condensed.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Upādānagocchakaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)🔽Kusalattikaupādānagocchakaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekam pe avigate eka upādāna gocchakam 🔽kusalattika aupādāna gocchakam
translated: (One from root cause, one from object … and so on … one from absence of conflict. (The section on clinging should be expanded in detail.)🔽The section on the root cause of the three wholesome and the section on the root cause of the three clinging are finished.)
